info-registry-entry.namespace-title: Namespace of identifiers used in the Repository of the LANL Research Library

namespace-authority.organisation-name: Los Alamos National Laboratory, Research Library
namespace-authority.organisation-address: MS-P362, PO Box 1663, Los Alamos, NM 87545-1362, USA

identifier-syntax.description: Identifiers in the lanl-repo namespace are used to identify information assets used in the repository of the Research Library of the Los Alamos National Laboratory. The syntax is of the form: info:lanl-repo/_type_/_identifier_ whereby: ∙ _type_ gives an indication of the nature and purpose of the identifier. Current values for _type_ include 'i' , 'svc' , 'voc' . Their meaning is explained in the Namespace Information section. ∙ _identifier_ is a unique string assigned to the information asset. Examples: ∙ info:lanl-repo/i/000b8c20-51b3-11d8-94f8-e15f3b151c3c ∙ info:lanl-repo/opac/125874 ∙ info:lanl-repo/svc/tomods.marc ∙ info:lanl-repo/voc/hasProfile

identifier-normalization.description: All identifiers in the lanl-repo namespace are case-sensitive.

namespace-information.description: Identifiers in the lanl-repo namespace are used to identify information assets used in the repository of the Research Library of the Los Alamos National Laboratory. Different types of identifiers are used in the repository, including: ∙ Repository Identifiers: Identifiers assigned by the repository ingestion process to MPEG-21 DIDL XML wrapper documents that are the unit of storage in the repository. These identifiers are also used for the identification of DIDL Items and DIDL Components (see MPEG-21 DIDL data model) contained in such XML wrapper documents. These identifiers are of the form: info:lanl-repo/i/_identifier_ whereby _identifier_ is a unique string assigned to an XML wrapper document. For the identification of DIDL Items and DIDL Components, fragments are used. Example: info:lanl-repo/i/000b8c20-51b3-11d8-94f8-e15f3b151c3c . ∙ Content Identifiers: Identifiers that are natively attached to a (set of) datastream(s) before ingestion into the repository. They are typically inherited from the ingested materials, as, in many cases those materials have identifiers that were attached to them when they were created/published. These identifiers are of the form: info:lanl-repo/_namespace_/_identifier_ whereby _namespace references the namespace from which identifiers were inherited, and _identifier_ is an identifier in that namespace. Example: info:lanl-repo/opac/125874 ∙ ServiceType identifiers: Identifiers accorded to services that can be applied to repository content. These identifiers are of the form info:lanl-repo/svc/_identifier_ whereby _identifier_ is a unique string acorded to a specific service. Example: info:lanl-repo/svc/tomods.marc. ∙ Identifiers for vocabulary terms: Identifiers used to represent properties of assets stored in the repository, or relationships between such assets. These identifiers are used in RDF statements. These identifiers are of the form info:lanl-repo/voc/_identifier_ whereby _identifier_ is a unique string acorded to a property or type of relationship. Example: info:lanl-repo/voc/hasProfile .
